courses.title: Baltic Politics
courses.description: Quarter-length program taking students through Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. Explores the region through topics related to democracy and discrimination, focusing on conflicts between representation and inclusion. Features guest lectures from local academics, diplomats, journalists, and policy professionals.

courses.title: Honors Research in Government
courses.description: Co-directed the Department of Government's Honors Program. Guides students in producing independent research, requiring completion of Honors Research course in fall, winter and spring terms working with faculty advisers, and thesis defense in public presentation.

courses.title: Experiments in Politics
courses.description: Teaches students how to design, implement, analyze, and write up results from experiments focused on discrimination. Students work throughout the term with the goal of publishing papers after the quarter ends. Has resulted in two published papers with students.

courses.title: Quantitative Political Analysis
courses.description: Teaches students the basics of computational social science, with work culminating in a quantitative-focused research paper.

baltic_leap.name: Baltic LEAP (Language, Energy, and Politics)
baltic_leap.description: Innovative quarter-length program through Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. Students spend approximately four weeks in Vilnius, two weeks in Riga, and four weeks in Tartu, with trips to Jūrmala, Kaunas, Klaipėda, Daugavpils, Narva, Sillamäe, and Tallinn. Lauded by Guarini Institute as 'innovative' and 'cutting edge.'
student_feedback: by far the most unique experience you will have
honestly … one of the best experiences of my life
impact: Influenced understanding of own cultural identity and biases
Made students take a more global view
Helped better connect with different types of people

teaching_philosophy: I view teaching and mentoring as ongoing conversations that occur both in and outside the classroom. In class, I teach students about statistical reasoning, research design, democratization, and discrimination. Outside of class, I try to be approachable, encouraging, and emotionally supportive.

institutions.name: Monash University
courses: Political Theory in a Changing World: Concepts, Issues and Debates
